0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Herpes labialis: apply TOPICALLY to lesions 5 times a day until lesions have healed

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Herpes labialis: 12 years of age and older, apply TOPICALLY to lesions 5 times a day until lesions have healed

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• patients with history of allergic phenomena related to topical medications
  • use only to treat oral-facial herpes simplex on the lips and face

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Topical: Docosanol reduces viral replication and activity by effectively inhibiting the fusion between the plasma membrane and the herpes simplex virus envelope.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
rub in gently to cover affected area completely

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Tell patient that drug is for herpetic lesions on lips and face only. Drug should not be used on genital herpes.
  • Avoid contact of drug with eyes.
  • This drug may cause application site reaction or headache.
